If humans could change their biological age at will, it would revolutionize the way we view aging and the quality of life. It would give people the freedom to live longer and enjoy more years with their loved ones. This could lead to a significant decrease in mortality rates and a shift in societal norms and expectations around age.

With the ability to change their biological age, people could potentially live longer and more productive lives. They could continue to work and contribute to society well into their later years, which would have a positive impact on the economy and overall well-being of society.

The ability to change biological age could also lead to a significant reduction in healthcare costs, as people would be able to age more gracefully and avoid many of the health issues that come with aging. This could also lead to a decrease in the burden on healthcare systems and an overall improvement in the quality of life for individuals.

If humans could change their biological age, it could also have a significant impact on the environment. As people age, they typically require more resources and produce more waste. By being able to age more slowly or reverse the aging process, individuals could reduce their impact on the environment and help to preserve resources for future generations.

The ability to change biological age could also have a significant impact on the way we view and approach death. If people could age more slowly or even reverse the aging process, death could become less of a fearful and inevitable event and more of a natural part of the human experience. This could lead to a shift in cultural attitudes and beliefs around death and dying.
